titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Frederic A. Blank (d. 1992) was a New York businessman. He served in the army during World War I, then returned home to his previous career as an export manager. In 1926, he worked in the wall-covering industry, and invented a washable, non-fading wall-covering. In 1940, he was appointed to the American and Foreign Panel of Arbitrators in the U.S. by the American Arbitration Association of New York. He also taught institutional decoration at Cornell University (1945) and joined the Executive Association of Greater New York (1945), becoming the vice president in 1948. He retired to Wilmington, Delaware, in 1949.

scopecontent.p: The Frederick Blank papers consist of material dating from 1807-1991. The collection focuses largely on subjects related to Blank's military service and to the wall-covering business. It includes books, court records, correspondence, membership cards, articles, booklets, tear sheets, memoranda, pamphlets, clippings, photographs, fabric sample books, class notes, business cards, wall-covering sample books, brochures and advertisements, printing plates, maps, and periodicals.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
